sen.j: 澤瀉十種（おもだかじっしゅ）は、昭和50年 (1975年) に市川猿之助 (3代目)が撰した澤瀉屋・市川猿之助のお家芸。
sen.e: Omodaka Jusshu refers to the specialty plays of Ennosuke ICHIKAWA of Omodakaya selected by Ennosuke the third in 1975.
Omodaka Jusshu refers to the specialty plays of Ennosuke ICHIKAWA of Omodakaya selected by Ennosuke the third in 1975.
Omodaka Jusshu refers to the specialty plays of Ennosuke ICHIKAWA of Omodakaya selected by Ennosuke the third in 1975.

sen.j: 祖父の市川猿翁が創作して初演した舞踊に、三代目自身が演出した舞踊を加えたものである。
sen.e: It consists of dances created and first performed by Eno ICHIKAWA, grandfather of Ennosuke the third, plus those produced by Ennosuke the third himself.
It consists of dances created and first performed by Eno ICHIKAWA, grandfather of Ennosuke the third, plus those produced by Ennosuke the third himself.
It consists of dances created and first performed by Eno ICHIKAWA, grandfather of Ennosuke the third, plus those produced by Ennosuke the third himself.

sen.j: これに先立つ「猿翁十種」とは異なり、こちらは祖父・孫の二代にわたる猿之助の創作舞踊なので、屋号の澤瀉屋をこの名称に冠した。
sen.e: Unlike the precedent "Eno Jusshu," these are dances created by two generations of Ennosuke, grandfather and grandson, so they are given the stage family name, Omodakaya.
Unlike the precedent 'Eno Jusshu,' these are dances created by two generations of Ennosuke, grandfather and grandson, so they are given the stage family name, Omodakaya.
Unlike the precedent 'Eno Jusshu,' these are dances created by two generations of Ennosuke, grandfather and grandson, so they are given the stage family name, Omodakaya.

sen.j: 三人片輪（さんにん かたわ）
猪八戒 (歌舞伎)（ちょはっかい）

sen.e: Ukiyo-buro (The bathhouse of the floating world)
Ukiyo-buro (The bathhouse of the floating world)

sen.j: 二人知盛（ににん とももり）

sen.e: Yugaodana (the trellis for the bottle gourd)
